frame.name: Setting_back_burn
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Firefighter</fen> sets a controlled fire to remove fuel from a currently incompletely controlled fire.</def-root>

FE.name: Firefighter
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Firefighter</fen> is the person making the firebreak.</def-root>

FE.name: Flame
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Flame</fen> is what is created by the <fen>Firefighter</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Flammables
FE.definition: <def-root>The Flammables is the the object that is burned in the back fire. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Firefighter</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An event brought about by the <fen>Firefighter</fen> that actually makes the <fen>Flammables</fen> catch fire.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows.</def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Firefighter</fen> as being in some state during the action.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: backfire.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a fire that uses up fuel from another fire, creating a firebreak.
